summary:
Ulcerative colitis (UC) is a long-term health problem that causes inflammation and sores in the colon and rectum. Common symptoms include stomach pain and bloody diarrhea. Other issues like weight loss and fever can also occur. The exact cause is unknown, but it might be linked to immune system issues, genes, and changes in gut bacteria.

Doctors use colonoscopies and biopsies to diagnose UC. Treatment includes medications like mesalazine and steroids to manage symptoms. In severe cases, surgery to remove the colon might be needed. This surgery can cure the condition.
title: Ulcerative colitis
